jobTitle: Senior North America Retail Channel Planner
description:
Gisou is born out of a passion for bees, haircare and natural beauty. Based on a six-generation beekeeping heritage, each Gisou product is inspired by and made with the finest, sustainably sourced ingredients from our very own Mirsalehi Bee Garden. With this method, our founder Negin and her father continue the family tradition of beekeeping. Our hair care and complexion products harness the transformative benefits of Mirsalehi Honey and rich botanical sources, selected to enhance ones natural beauty.

We are committed to a bee-friendly & sustainable production method that puts the Mirsalehi Honey Bees first, not only for the sake of the bees, but the greater ecosystem as well. In the upcoming years, we intend to continue to develop high-quality honey infused beauty products as we develop a globally renowned label and raise awareness about the importance of a healthy bee population.

We have been experiencing double digital growth YoY and have established ourselves as a leading hair care line across our global retailers such as Sephora, Selfridges, Mecca, and Harrods. We are currently available in over 40 countries and are on an explosive journey of growth as we launch in new markets, open additional channels and focus on building our team internationally.

Our team is the heart of our business, without an incredible team we would not be where we are today and where we dream to go tomorrow. Being a part of Gisou is for those who are passionate, ambitious, hard working, agile and approachable. Join us on this epic journey!

About The Role

As the Senior North America Retail Channel Planner, you will be at the forefront of driving our retail sales and revenue growth. Partnering with the NA Sales Team, you'll develop and adjust budgets and forecasts, ensuring alignment with company goals. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, lead monthly reforecasting, and create detailed sales plans. You'll manage inventory risks, spearhead S&OP meetings, and negotiate with retail partners. Your strategic insights and analytical expertise will be key in optimizing our retail performance and identifying future opportunities.

Key Responsibilities

  • Partner with NA Sales Team on building bottoms up and tops down budgets, adjusting forecasts monthly, in order to achieve both sell out and sell in company goals.
  • Take ownership of preparing, managing, and delivering the retail sales and revenue budgets. Responsible for sharing with key cross functional partners including OPS, PD, Marketing, and Finance.
  • Lead monthly reforecast process with comparison to Budget, Forecast and LY. Clearly articulate risks & opportunities. Adjust forecasts as necessary to reflect market conditions, promotions and sales performance.
  • Develop retail sales plans by week, by product, by channel and by customer. Build weekly revenue plans for accounts based on monthly Stock & Sales plans and refresh weekly. Maintain and update weekly revenue tracker.
  • Partner with supply chain, OPS, and PD teams to ensure production plans align with sales forecasts. Work closely with demand planning to discern any product availability implications, and assess any shipment risks. Make any adjustments needed for future orders.
  • Analyze and report on upcoming inventory risks to the business across all channels.
  • Consolidate NA agenda topics for weekly S&OP Meetings and own follow up execution coming out of the meeting.
  • Key point of contact for retailer planning partners. Conduct monthly TB’s with retailers to understand OTB updates and any changes, opportunities or constraints. Negotiates Stock & Sales Plan with retailer and leads the negotiation on inventory needs/requests with rationale.
  • Collaborate with the Sales team on NPD quantities using historical brand and market data. Document assumptions. Once retailers place orders, review submitted orders to ensure it is accurate for what was agreed upon with the retailer, esp by channel.
  • Weekly review of inventory KPIs and evaluate any lost sales or SKUs with low WOS; address any issues with retail partners and elevate to sales team.
  • Oversee and partner with OPS on all account related inventory management processes including RTV’s, T&D, markdowns, disco’s (dispositions), any inventory adjustments, with particular focus on proactively minimizing returns and DIFs. Track monthly and monitor compliance.
  • Collaborate with Field Sales and Education Director on building regional and by door sales goals for Account Executives. Track results vs forecast and share with team weekly.
  • Build and maintain channel planning and forecasting tools in excel.
  • Generate ad-hoc reports to support business decisions for cross-functional teams and assist in making recommendations to internal leaders.
  • Create and publish Weekly and Monthly retail reports for North America. Create insightful metrics and comprehensive scorecards that turn data into action.
  • Ensure data accuracy for all reporting and be able to clearly articulate business drivers, observations, learnings and actions.
  • Lead monthly, quarterly, and seasonal hindsight analyses to uncover future opportunities and identify product risks and opportunities. Provide actionable hindsight analysis to support the planning process.

WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Minimum 7 years’ experience in Retail Channel Planning, Finance or Retail Operations

Must be an expert in Microsoft Excel, with knowledge of data warehouse orchestration, demonstrated experience with retail analytics data models, and history of building these types of files from scratch.

Must have Sephora brick & mortar retail sell in experience

Strong business acumen and financial aptitude

Strong reporting and analytical skills

Advanced Excel skills

Achievement oriented

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

Is Customer focused– Wants to give the client what they want!

Commercially minded and profit-driven

Strong attention to detail, collaborative and results driven

Ability to manage multiple and sometimes conflicting priorities within the business

Ability to work independently and thrive in a fast-paced environment

Strong negotiating and influencing skills

What We Offer

Our team's wellbeing is super important to us, therefore we offer fitness membership via Classpass, and mental health support via OpenUp to all our employees. Gisou is a fast growing and disruptive beauty company that offers huge opportunities for personal development and growth.

INTERESTED?

We can't wait to hear from you.
